alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Carroll, Jo Daviess and west central Stephenson Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodbine, or 16 miles east of Galena, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and possibly weak, brief tornadoes and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Isolated damage to roofs, siding and trees is possible. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Galena, Stockton, Warren, Elizabeth, Woodbine, Scales Mound, Apple River, Council Hill, Schapville, Massbach, Guilford, North Hanover, Elizabeth Fairgrounds, Canyon Camp, Willow, Apple River Canyon State Park, Stockton Airport, Elmoville, Galena Territory, and Apple Canyon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of funnel clouds, and possibly brief, weak tornadoes. The National Weather Service will conntinue to closely monitor the situation, and may issue a Tornado Warning if the threat increases. If you see a funnel cloud please seek shelter indoors and then contact your local law enforcement agency for relay to the National Weather Service. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
